TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed UIControlState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: An enumeration of possible states for a .
Docs.remarks: Flags representing the state of a control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Application = unsigned int32(16711680)

Docs.summary: Mask for application defined states for a control. Possible application-reservedd values are 0x00010000 to 0x00ff0000.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Disabled = unsigned int32(2)

Docs.summary: Control is in the disabled state. You can change this through the Enabled property of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Highlighted = unsigned int32(1)

Docs.summary: Control is highlighted. You can change this through the Highlighted property of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Normal = unsigned int32(0)

Docs.summary: The normal state of the control (not disabled and not higlighted)

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Reserved = unsigned int32(4278190080)

Docs.summary: Reserved mask, no states should be defined in this range by the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIControlState Selected = unsigned int32(4)

Docs.summary: Selected state of the control. You can change this value by accessing the Selected property of the UIControl.
